title: Editor's Choice
text:
Pictures | Mon Apr 16, 2018 | 7:47am EDT Editor's Choice 
Central American migrants, moving in a caravan through Mexico, journey an open wagon of a freight train after stopping it on the rail line, in Hidalgo state, Mexico. REUTERS/Edgard Garrido Reuters / Sunday, April 15, 2018 Central American migrants, moving in a caravan through Mexico, journey an open wagon of a freight train after stopping it on the rail line, in Hidalgo state, Mexico. REUTERS/Edgard Garrido Close 1 / 25 
Mave Grace, 11, who had part of her arm chopped off by   with her sister Racahele-Ngabausi, aged two, in an Internally Displaced Camp   of... more Reuters / Sunday, April 15, 2018 Mave Grace, 11, who had part of her arm chopped off by   with her sister Racahele-Ngabausi, aged two, in an Internally Displaced Camp   injured her sister, Racahele-Ngabausi. REUTERS/Goran Tomasevic Close 2 / 25 
A Syrian firefighter is seen inside the destroyed Scientific Research Centre in Damascus, Syria. REUTERS/Omar Sanadiki Reuters / Saturday, April 14, 2018 A Syrian firefighter is seen inside the destroyed Scientific Research Centre in Damascus, Syria. REUTERS/Omar Sanadiki Close 3 / 25 
A gild holds a placard during a protest against the rape of an eight-year-old girl in Kathua, near Jammu, in Kochi, India. REUTERS/Sivaram V Reuters / Sunday, April 15, 2018 A gild holds a placard during a protest against the rape of an eight-year-old girl in Kathua, near Jammu, in Kochi, India. REUTERS/Sivaram V Close 4 / 25 
Scotland's Callum Hawkins lies on the ground as Australia's Michael Shelley runs past during the Men's Marathon Final at the Commonwealth Games on the Gold Coast in Australia. AAP/Tracey Nearmy/via REUTERS Reuters / Sunday, April 15, 2018 Scotland's Callum Hawkins lies on the ground as Australia's Michael Shelley runs past during the Men's Marathon Final at the Commonwealth Games on the Gold Coast in Australia. AAP/Tracey Nearmy/via REUTERS Close 
The audience of the closing ceremony of the Commonwealth Games, Gold Coast, Australia. REUTERS/Athit Perawongmetha Reuters / Sunday, April 15, 2018 The audience of the closing ceremony of the Commonwealth Games, Gold Coast, Australia. REUTERS/Athit Perawongmetha Close 6 / 25 
Sumo wrestlers perform a show fight during an annual sumo tournament dedicated to the Yasukuni Shrine in Tokyo, Japan. REUTERS/Toru Hanai Reuters / Monday, April 16, 2018 Sumo wrestlers perform a show fight during an annual sumo tournament dedicated to the Yasukuni Shrine in Tokyo, Japan. REUTERS/Toru Hanai Close 7 / 25 
Protesters clash with French   in   Sunday, April 15, 2018 Protesters clash with French   in   8 / 25 
A banner calling for justice is seen next to a photo of assassinated anti-corruption journalist Daphne Caruana Galizia at the bomb site, as Maltese prepare to mark six months since her murder, in Bidnija, Malta. REUTERS/Darrin Zammit Lupi Reuters / Sunday, April 15, 2018 A banner calling for justice is seen next to a photo of assassinated anti-corruption journalist Daphne Caruana Galizia at the bomb site, as Maltese prepare to mark six months since her murder, in Bidnija, Malta. REUTERS/Darrin Zammit Lupi Close 9 / 25 
Baby elephants play at the David Sheldrick Elephant Orphanage in the Nairobi National Park, near Nairobi, Kenya. REUTERS/Baz Ratner Reuters / Saturday, April 14, 2018 Baby elephants play at the David Sheldrick Elephant Orphanage in the Nairobi National Park, near Nairobi, Kenya. REUTERS/Baz Ratner Close 10 / 25 
Hong Kong actors Law Kar-ying and Michael Ning pose on red carpet at the 37th Hong Kong Film Awards. REUTERS/Bobby Yip Reuters / Sunday, April 15, 2018 Hong Kong actors Law Kar-ying and Michael Ning pose on red carpet at the 37th Hong Kong Film Awards. REUTERS/Bobby Yip Close 11 / 25 
Capercaillies are seen at the mating ground in a forest near the village of Vyganashchy, Belarus. REUTERS/Vasily Fedosenko Reuters / Sunday, April 15, 2018 Capercaillies are seen at the mating ground in a forest near the village of Vyganashchy, Belarus. REUTERS/Vasily Fedosenko Close 12 / 25 
A devotee gets his face smeared with vermillion powder during "Sindoor Jatra" vermillion powder festival at Thimi, in Bhaktapur, Nepal. REUTERS/Navesh Chitrakar Reuters / Sunday, April 15, 2018 A devotee gets his face smeared with vermillion powder during "Sindoor Jatra" vermillion powder festival at Thimi, in Bhaktapur, Nepal. REUTERS/Navesh Chitrakar Close 13 / 25 
Palestinian karate coach Samah Shaheen, 39, teaches girls a karate lesson, in Salfit in the occupied West Bank. REUTERS/Raneen Sawafta Reuters / Sunday, April 15, 2018 Palestinian karate coach Samah Shaheen, 39, teaches girls a karate lesson, in Salfit in the occupied West Bank. REUTERS/Raneen Sawafta Close 14 / 25 
A concertgoer is wearing a feather headpiece at the Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival in Indio, California. REUTERS/Mario Anzuoni Reuters / Sunday, April 15, 2018 A concertgoer is wearing a feather headpiece at the Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival in Indio, California. REUTERS/Mario Anzuoni Close 15 / 25 
Demonstrators take part in a protest against the shooting of Rio de Janeiro city councillor Marielle Franco one month after her death, in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. REUTERS/Lucas Landau Reuters / Saturday, April 14, 2018 Demonstrators take part in a protest against the shooting of Rio de Janeiro city councillor Marielle Franco one month after her death, in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. REUTERS/Lucas Landau Close 16 / 25 
Red Bull's Daniel Ricciardo drinks from a shoe as he celebrates winning the Formula One Chinese Grand Prix at Shanghai International Circuit, Shanghai, China.REUTERS/Aly Song Reuters / Sunday, April 15, 2018 Red Bull's Daniel Ricciardo drinks from a shoe as he celebrates winning the Formula One Chinese Grand Prix at Shanghai International Circuit, Shanghai, China.REUTERS/Aly Song Close 17 / 25 
People attend a protest against the government of Prime Minister Viktor Orban in Budapest, Hungary. REUTERS/Bernadett Szabo Reuters / Saturday, April 14, 2018 People attend a protest against the government of Prime Minister Viktor Orban in Budapest, Hungary. REUTERS/Bernadett Szabo Close 18 / 25 
Davy Russell kisses the trophy as he celebrates winning the 17:15 Randox Health Grand National Handicap Chase.��� Action Images via Reuters/Matthew Childs Reuters / Saturday, April 14, 2018 Davy Russell kisses the trophy as he celebrates winning the 17:15 Randox Health Grand National Handicap Chase.��� Action Images via Reuters/Matthew Childs Close 19 / 25 
Syrians wave Iranian, Russian and Syrian flags during a protest against U.S.-led air strikes in Damascus, Syria. REUTERS/ Omar Sanadiki Reuters / Saturday, April 14, 2018 Syrians wave Iranian, Russian and Syrian flags during a protest against U.S.-led air strikes in Damascus, Syria. REUTERS/ Omar Sanadiki Close 20 / 25 
Vikas Krishan of India in action with Dieudonne Wilfried Seyi Ntsengue of Cameroon during the Men's 75kg Final Bout at the Commonwealth Games. REUTERS/Athit Perawongmetha Reuters / Saturday, April 14, 2018 Vikas Krishan of India in action with Dieudonne Wilfried Seyi Ntsengue of Cameroon during the Men's 75kg Final Bout at the Commonwealth Games. REUTERS/Athit Perawongmetha Close 
A missile is seen crossing over Damascus, Syria. SANA/Handout via REUTERS Reuters / Saturday, April 14, 2018 A missile is seen crossing over Damascus, Syria. SANA/Handout via REUTERS Close 22 / 25 
A U.S. Military cadet crawls under a barbed wire obstacle as he competes in the 50th annual Sandhurst Military Skills Competition, a rigorous two-day event where teams of eight men and women from military academies and universities from 13 countries... more Reuters / Friday, April 13, 2018 A U.S. Military cadet crawls under a barbed wire obstacle as he competes in the 50th annual Sandhurst Military Skills Competition, a rigorous two-day event where teams of eight men and women from military academies and universities from 13 countries are tested in multiple military skills, athletic proficiency and leadership abilities at the United States Military Academy at West Point, New York. REUTERS/Mike Segar Close 23 / 25 
North Korean leader Kim Jong Un meets Song Tao, the head of the China's Communist Party's International Department who led a Chinese art troupe to North Korea for the April Spring Friendship Art Festival, in this handout photo released by North... more Reuters / Saturday, April 14, 2018 North Korean leader Kim Jong Un meets Song Tao, the head of the China's Communist Party's International Department who led a Chinese art troupe to North Korea for the April Spring Friendship Art Festival, in this handout photo released by North Korea's Korean Central News Agency (KCNA). KCNA/via REUTERS Close 24 / 25 
The Weeknd performs at the Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival in Indio, California. REUTERS/Mario Anzuoni Reuters / Saturday, April 14, 2018 The Weeknd performs at the Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival in Indio, California. REUTERS/Mario Anzuoni Close
